SENT.plain: INTRODUCTION: Bevacizumab is a monoclonal antibody against vascular endothelial growth factor
It is widely used in the treatment of metastatic colorectal cancer
It has some specific side effects including severe bleeding, wound healing problems, gastrointestinal perforation, proteinuria and hypertension
CASE PRESENTATION: We present the case of a 65-year old Asian man with synovial metastasis of the knee who experienced intraarticular hemorrhage after bevacizumab treatment
He presented with monoarthritis of the left knee
CONCLUSION: Bevacizumab-related hemorrhage can cause serious morbidity and unusual sites of hemorrhage may be seen
